intro: Monocera subintegerrima, commonly known as the smooth-leaved monocera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
